verses.roman:
ei śikṣā sabākāre, sabe mane kaila
ācārya-gosāñi mane ānanda pāila

synonyms: ei—this; śikṣā—instruction; sabākāre—for all; sabe—all present; mane—in the mind; kaila—took it; ācārya-gosāñi—Advaita Ācārya; mane—within the mind; ānanda—pleasure; pāila—felt.
translation: When Caitanya Mahāprabhu gave this instruction to Kamalākānta, all present considered it to be meant for everyone. Thus Advaita Ācārya was greatly pleased.
